intent: Defensive network and web security fundamentals, architecture reasoning, and common risk patterns. No exploit instructions.

sections.name: Network Segmentation
sections.summary: Divide networks into logical segments to reduce lateral movement and blast radius.
principles: Separate public-facing systems from internal systems.
Restrict east-west traffic with policy controls.
Use VLANs, firewalls, or microsegmentation for isolation.
riskPatterns: Flat networks enabling rapid lateral movement.

sections.name: Firewalls & Gateways
sections.summary: Control inbound and outbound traffic based on defined policies.
principles: Limit exposed ports to required services.
Log and alert on policy violations.

sections.name: Secure Web Architecture
sections.summary: Design web applications and APIs to minimize attack surface and enforce validation.
principles: Validate and sanitize all user input.
Use parameterized queries to prevent injection flaws.
Implement proper authentication and session management.

sections.name: Common Web Application Risks
sections.summary: High-level defensive awareness of common vulnerability classes.
notes: Focus on mitigation strategies rather than exploit mechanics.
Tie vulnerabilities to secure coding and review practices.

sections.name: DDoS & Availability Resilience
sections.summary: Protect availability through redundancy and traffic management.

sections.name: TLS & Data Encryption
sections.summary: Protect data in transit using strong cryptographic protocols.

lawOverlap: Data protection regulations related to transmission security.
Breach liability exposure for insecure web design.
